Metadata: The coastal decision-making framework as a model for ocean management
"Proceedings National Conference on the States and an Extended Territorial Sea," pp. 92-100, December 9-11, 1985.

An issue that will arise with increasing frequency is the long-term commitment of ocean space to a particular use: oil and gas production; mineral extraction; sanctuaries; research stations; mariculture; recreation; waste disposal; energy production; etc. Each of these uses requires that a site be selected and alternative uses limited. Making site selection decisions requires finding a balance among use opportunities, trading off development and preservation values, and ensuring predictability and fairness in the decision-making process; the coastal decision model can be a useful tool.
